L1PHY_Energy_Concepts.card: Series circuit with a battery and two resistors
Parallel circuit with a battery and two resistors
Series circuit with a battery, a switch, and a resistor
Combined circuit with two resistors in parallel and one in series with the battery
A series circuit with three resistors and the voltmeter connected incorrectly
Parallel circuit with two branches, each containing two resistors in series
Design a circuit with a total resistance of 100 Ω using any combination of available resistors
Create a parallel circuit where the current through the battery is 2A
Build a circuit where the voltage drop across one specific resistor is 5V. Must be three or more resistors in the circuit.
Create a circuit with three parallel branches, where the current in each branch decreases by 0.1A (e.g., 0.3A, 0.2A, 0.1A)
Build a combined circuit where the total current is 1A, but one branch receives 0.75A and the other 0.25A
A parallel circuit with two resistors and a battery where the voltmeter is connected correctly but the ammeter is connected incorrectly
Design a voltage divider circuit that outputs exactly 3.3V from a 9V battery
Construct a circuit where increasing one resistor's value by 20% results in a 10% decrease in total current
Build a circuit with four resistors where the voltage drop across each is exactly 3V
Parallel circuit with a battery and three resistors
Combined circuit with a battery, a switch, and three resistors (two in parallel, one in series)
Construct a circuit that delivers 10W of power to a specific component
Construct a circuit where the power dissipated in two different resistors is the same, despite them having different resistance values
Design a circuit where the power dissipated in the entire circuit is evenly distributed among three different resistors
Series circuit with two batteries and one resistor
Series circuit with a variable resistor (potentiometer) and a fixed resistor
Design a circuit where the current splits evenly between two parallel branches
Create a circuit that maintains a constant current through one resistor regardless of changes to another variable resistor
Create a circuit where the current through one branch is double the current through another parallel branch
Build a circuit where the current through two parallel branches is split in a 2:1 ratio
Construct a combined series-parallel circuit where the equivalent resistance is exactly 10 Ω. Must be three or more resistors in the circuit.
Construct a voltage divider to get 4V output over a resistor with a 12V supply. Include a voltmeter across the 4V resistor.
Create a series circuit where the current through the battery is 2A. Must use at least three resistors.
Create a circuit with two lamps where if one lamp burns out, the other lamp's brightness increases
Build a circuit where a 1A fuse protects a parallel combination of two lamps, each drawing 0.4A
Create a parallel circuit where two ammeters show different readings, but a voltmeter across the entire circuit reads 12V
Build a circuit where a voltmeter reading remains constant when a resistor is changed, but an ammeter reading in the same loop changes
Build a circuit that has two lamps and three states using two switches. 1) All lamps off, 2) One lamp on, 3) Both lamps on
Build a circuit with a battery and lamp in series and two resistors connected in series OR parallel. When you add a resistor it should increase the brightness of the lamp.
